organization.name: Hillsmere Shores Improvement Association (HSIA)
organization.description: Located 3 miles southwest of historic downtown Annapolis, Maryland. Nestled between Duvall Creek and Quiet Waters Park, Hillsmere Shores is a quiet, waterfront community with approximately 1,200 homes.

board_meetings.schedule: Monthly HSIA Board Meetings at 7:00 PM
board_meetings.location: Community meetings - check HSIA website for details
board_meetings.general_membership: HSIA General Membership Meeting - typically September

documents.building_permits: HSIA Building Permits required for modifications
documents.description: All major documents available on hillsmereshores.org

marina.description: Private marina with direct access to the South River
features: Living Shoreline at the Sand Spit

other_amenities: Mature trees including cypress trees along Hillsmere Drive

pets.leash_law: All dogs/cats must be on a leash at all times in the community
pets.applies_to: Marina, pool grounds, surrounding open field, and all streets
pets.reporting: Call Anne Arundel County Animal Control 410-222-8900

building_permits.requirement: HSIA Building Permits required for community modifications
building_permits.process: Must obtain permits through HSIA before beginning work

nearby_facilities: Key School campus (includes original estate buildings)

natural_features: Located between Duvall Creek and Quiet Waters Park
Original cypress trees along main road

history.development: Purchased by Smith Brothers and developed 1952-59
history.historical_buildings: Original estate buildings incorporated into Key School campus including dairy barn and Manor House
history.description: Originally a gentleman's farm in early 1900s

community_communication.email_list: HSIA email list for important events and issues (membership not required)
community_communication.website_note: HSIA does not sponsor other social media platforms beyond official Facebook
